00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantExprMethod.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 10:11:43 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Interface for computing quantification summaries from PM intensities
00028  * grouped into probe set groups.
00029  * 
00030  */
00031 #ifndef _QUANTEXPRMETHOD_H_
00032 #define _QUANTEXPRMETHOD_H_
00033 
00034 //
00035 #include "chipstream/ChipLayout.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/ChipStream.h"
00037 #include "chipstream/IntensityMart.h"
00038 #include "chipstream/PmAdjuster.h"
00039 #include "chipstream/ProbeSet.h"
00040 #include "chipstream/QuantMethod.h"
00041 //
00042 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00043 //
00044 #include <cstring>
00045 #include <string>
00046 #include <vector>
00047 //
00048 
00049 /**
00050  *  QuantExprMethod - Interface for computing quantification summaries from PM intensities
00051  * grouped into probe set groups.
00052  * 
00053  */
00054 class QuantExprMethod : public QuantMethod {
00055 
00056 public:
00057   
00058   /** 
00059    * @brief Virtual destructor for a virtual class.
00060    */
00061   virtual ~QuantExprMethod() {};
00062 
00063   /** 
00064    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00065    * 
00066    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00067    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00068    * @param data - Data to be set.
00069    */
00070   virtual void setPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) = 0;
00071 
00072   /** 
00073    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00074    * 
00075    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00076    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00077    */
00078   virtual double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) = 0;
00079 
00080   /** 
00081    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00082    * 
00083    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00084    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00085    * @param data - Data to be set.
00086    */
00087   virtual void setMMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data) = 0;
00088 
00089   /** 
00090    * @brief Clear out all the data.
00091    */
00092   virtual void clear()  = 0;
00093 
00094   /** 
00095    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00096    * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00097    * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00098    */
00099   virtual void setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips) = 0;
00100 
00101   /** 
00102    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00103    * @return feature count.
00104    */
00105   virtual unsigned int getNumFeatures() = 0;
00106 
00107   /** 
00108    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00109    * @return target count
00110    */
00111   virtual unsigned int getNumTargets() = 0;
00112 
00113   /** 
00114    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00115    * @return true or false if getFeatureEffects() supplies estimates.
00116    */
00117   virtual bool haveFeatureEffects() { return false; }
00118 
00119   /** 
00120    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe.
00121    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00122    * @return feature (probe) effects.
00123    */
00124   virtual double getFeatureEffect(unsigned int probeIx) = 0;
00125 
00126   /** 
00127    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00128    * primary interest.
00129    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00130    * @return estimated intensity.
00131    */
00132   virtual double getTargetEffect(unsigned int chipIx) = 0; 
00133 
00134   /** 
00135    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00136    * @return Return true if getResidual() works, false otherwise.
00137    */
00138   virtual bool haveResiduals() { return false; }
00139 
00140   /** 
00141    * @brief Get the residual (the intensity not explained by model). This is
00142    * often supplied as log() transformed.
00143    *
00144    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe sets.
00145    * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00146    * @return intensity not explained by model.
00147    */
00148   virtual double getResidual(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) = 0;
00149 
00150   /** 
00151    * @brief Get the estimated intensity for a chip. This is usually the data of
00152    * primary interest. Alias for getTargetEffect()
00153    * @param chipIx - Index of chip in experiment.
00154    * @return estimated intensity.
00155    */
00156   virtual double getSignalEstimate(unsigned int chipIx) = 0;
00157 
00158   /** 
00159    * @brief What is the name of the quantification method?
00160    * @return name of adjuster.
00161    */  
00162   virtual std::string getType() { return m_Type; }
00163 
00164   /** 
00165    * @brief Was this probe used for the estimate?
00166    * @param probeIx - index of probe in probe set.
00167    * @return true if feature (probe) was used, false otherwise.
00168    */
00169   virtual bool featureUsed(unsigned int probeIx) { return true; }
00170   
00171   /** 
00172    * @brief Get the Probe for a particular index in the probe set.
00173    * @param probeIx - index of probe in probe set.
00174    * @return - Probe pointer of interest.
00175    */
00176   virtual const Probe *getFeature(unsigned int probeIx) { return m_Probes[probeIx]; }
00177 
00178   /**
00179    * @brief What should the filename for summaries be called?
00180    */
00181   virtual const std::string &getSummarySuffix() {
00182     static std::string suffix = ".summary.txt";
00183     return suffix;
00184   }
00185   
00186   /**
00187    * @brief What should the feature response file be called?
00188    */
00189   virtual const std::string &getFeatureResponseSuffix() {
00190     static std::string suffix = ".feature-response.txt";
00191     return suffix;
00192   }
00193 
00194   /**
00195    * @brief What should the residual file be called?
00196    */
00197   virtual const std::string &getResidualSuffix() {
00198     static std::string suffix = ".residuals.txt";
00199     return suffix;
00200   }
00201 
00202    /** 
00203    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00204    * @return version string. abstract method which specific
00205    * algorithm must implement. 
00206    */
00207   virtual inline std::string getVersion()=0;
00208 
00209 protected :
00210 
00211   /// Type of method
00212   std::string m_Type; 
00213   /// Probes used, memory not owned here. 
00214   std::vector<Probe *> m_Probes;
00215 };
00216 
00217 #endif /* _QUANTMETHOD_H_ */
